My Tools

My_tools.my_utility.set_output_path(main_path: str = '/Users/alena/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Personal/Work/PhD/Projects/Isochrone_Archive/Coding_logs/')

Automatically sets the output directory to a folder named after the current date.

Parameters:

main_path – Path to the directory containing the coding-logs

Returns:

path-string

My_tools.my_utility.setup_HP(filepath_and_name: str, name_string: Optional[str] = None)

Reading in hyperparameters from the HP file at the given location. Either accepts a custom name string, or the one saved as default for more flexibility.

Parameters:

  • filepath_and_name – path to the HP file

  • name_string – String of csv headings or column names that will be the keys of the HP dictionary

Returns:

either reads the file into a dataframe or opens a new one where it writes the name-string

My_tools.plotting_essentials.Archive_plot_2D(isochrone_data: list, age_info: list, plotting_dict: dict, scalar_mappable, one_panel: bool = False)

Two-dimensional version of the masterplot.

Parameters:

  • isochrone_data – List of empirical isochrones

  • age_info – List containing the name of the reference age column, as well as its boundaries.

  • plotting_dict – Dictionary containing specific plotting parameters.

  • scalar_mappable – Colormap object for the colorbar

  • one_panel – Only plot the BP-RP CMD.

Returns:

Figure

My_tools.plotting_essentials.Archive_plot_interactive(isochrone_data, line_data: list, cluster_list: list, plotting_dict, color_list, one_panel: bool = False)

Interactive plot of the empirical isochrones in the archive.

Parameters:

  • isochrone_data – Cluster data

  • line_data – List containing all empirical isochrone data

  • cluster_list – Namelist of the clusters

  • plotting_dict – Dictionary containing specific plotting parameters.

  • color_list – Colors for the isochrones

  • one_panel – Only plot the BP-RP CMD.

Returns:

Interactive figure (Html-file)

My_tools.plotting_essentials.CMD_density_design(A, gamma: float = 0.7, to_RBG: Optional[list] = None, from_RBG: Optional[list] = None, marker: str = '.', s: int = 50, density_plot=True, kde: bool = False, cluster_obj=None, fig_specs: Optional[list] = None, title_axes_specs: Optional[list] = None)

Density map and plots of the clusters.

Parameters:

  • A – 2D array of scatter data to be color-coded according to its density

  • gamma – Power-norm coefficient

  • to_RBG – Lighter color

  • from_RBG – Darker color

  • marker – Marker-Style

  • s – Marker-Size

  • density_plot – returns figure if true

  • kde – return kde

  • cluster_obj – cluster object instance for grabbing names and labels

  • fig_specs – Figure size

  • title_axes_specs – list of title, x-axis, y-axis labels

Returns:

either figure, kde, or x_density, y_density + plotting kwargs

My_tools.plotting_essentials.masterplot(isochrone_data: list, age_col: str = 'ref_age', id_col: str = 'Cluster_id', interactive_plot: bool = False, age_limits: Optional[list] = None, plotting_dict: Optional[dict] = None, one_panel: Optional[int] = None, save_plot_path: Optional[str] = None)

Function for plotting the most important summary plot of all empirical isochrones calculated for the archive.

Parameters:

  • isochrone_data – List of calculated empirical isochrones.

  • age_col – Column name for the reference age data.

  • id_col – Column name for the cluster names.

  • interactive_plot – Boolean indicator for whether an interactive (html) version of the figure should be created

  • age_limits – Upper and lower reference age limits of isochrones that should be plotted.

  • plotting_dict – Dictionary with specific plotting parameters.

  • one_panel – Only plot the BP-RP CMD.

  • save_plot_path – Path to output location.

Returns:

Figure
